oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Martha White - 1952-07-12 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Martha White sponsored Grand Ole Opry show from July 12, 1952. Hosted by Ernest Tubb. Part 1: http://cmfdigitization.cmf.int:2011/cdm/ref/collection/musicaudio/id/266
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys; Ernest Tubb; Chet Atkins; Hank Williams; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: The Brakeman's Blues (Bill Monroe and His Blue Grass Boys) -- Somebody's Stolen My Honey (Ernest Tubb) -- Martha White commercial (Jud Collins) -- Rainbow (Chet Atkins) -- Honky Tonkin' (Hank Williams) -- Jud Collins introduces Fuller Warren, Governor of Florida -- Give Me A Little Old Fashioned Love (Ernest Tubb) -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Tommy Jackson) -- Closing statement (Ernest Tubb) -- Martha White jingle -- Martha White commercial (Jud Collins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Martha White Foods; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Blue Grass Boys; Byrd, Billy; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Collins, Jud; Atkins, Chet; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Warren, Fuller, 1905-1973; Jackson, Tommy
